description.p: Your body has become that of an Ooze. You gain various abilities based on the type of ooze you choose. You no longer need to sleep or breathe, but you still must eat. That said as an Ooze you can eat a lot of things. At 1st level you become an Ooze choosing your Ooze type which grants you special abilities and features. You gain more abilities from your choice at later levels. You also become Resistant to Acid and Immune to Prone. You become immune to Acid at 10th level. You gain further Oozey Abilities based on your ooze type at 5th, 7th, 9th, 11th, 15th and 17th levels. For most oozes you are not going to be able to wear or wield most gear or magic items. However you can temporarily consume a magic item. When you do so the magic item seems to melt into your body, subsumed by your ooze and becoming a part of you. For the duration you gain the effects of the magic item. If the item requires attunement you must attune to it as part of this process. The item becomes inaccessible to anyone else until you spend some time regurgitating, or reconstituting the item.
As an Ooze, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 12 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d12 (or 7) + your Constitution modifier per Ooze level after 1st
Skills: Choose two skills from Athletics, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, and Survival

description.p: Your acid body grows stronger. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits you corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5 the weapon is destroyed. You have a similar effect on nonmagical metal armor. After dealing damage to someone wearing nonmagical metal armor that armor takes a cumulative -1 penalty to AC. Any armors that have their AC reduced by -5 this way is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage. You can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal, in 1 round.

description.p: You gain Proficiency in Stealth, gaining proficiency in another skill if you were already proficient in Stealth, and use Constitution in place of Dexterity for Stealth.
Even when in plain sight it takes a successful Wisdom (Perception) check to spot you when you have neither moved nor attacked.
The DC for this check is equal to 10 plus your Stealth modifier. It is as if you have a Passive Stealth score when not moving or attacking.
A creature that tries to enter you space while unaware of you is surprised by you.

You have a passive stealth skill of {{stealth}} and when a creature that tries to enter your space while unaware of you is surprised by you.

description.p: You gain the ability to engulf your enemies. Other creatures can enter your space, but a creature that does so is subject to your Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw. Creatures inside you can be seen but have total cover. A creature within 5 feet of you can take an action to pull a creature or object out of you. Doing so requires a successful DC (8+your proficiency+your Con mod) Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes your Ooze Touch damage.

As an Action you can attempt an Engulf. You move up to your speed. While doing so you can enter a Large or smaller creatures’ spaces. Whenever you enter a creature’s space the creature must make a DC (8+your proficiency+your Con mod) DC Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of you. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, you enter the creature’s space, and the creature takes your Ooze Touch damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can’t breathe, is restrained, and takes double your Ooze Touch damage at the start of each of your turns. When you move the engulfed creature moves with you.

An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a DC (8+your proficiency mod+your Con mod) Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of you.

On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5ft. On a fail, you enter the creature’s space, and the creature takes your Ooze Touch damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can’t breathe, is restrained, and takes double your Ooze Touch damage at the start of each of your turns. When you move the engulfed creature moves with you.

description.p: You grow in size, becoming Large and gain the ability to split into new jellies when subject to lightning or slashing damage.
When a jelly that is Medium or larger, including your original large jelly form, is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new jellies if it has at least 10 hit points.
Each new jelly has hit points equal to half the original jelly’s rounded down. New jellies are one size smaller than the original jelly.

All of your jellies count as separate creatures, and are immune to any mind control that does not affect all of them, they all have their own actions and reactions and all take their turns on your initiative.

Each jelly has maximum hit points equal to half the max of the size above them. A Medium jelly has half your max hit points, a Small has a quarter, and so on. At the end of combat any remaining jellies may come together as an action to pool hit points.
You are not required to do this if you so choose.

sheet.description: You become a Large Creature.

When attacked by Lightning or Slashing damage, you can split into 2 Jellys that are a size lower than the original and have half of your current hit points ({{hp}}). All of your jellies count as separate creatures, and are immune to any mind control that does not affect all of them, they all have their own actions and reactions and all take their turns on your initiative. The maximum Hit Points is {{hp}}/2 for Medium Jellys and {{hp}}/4 for Small Jellys with a minimum HP of 10.

When attacked by Lightning or Slashing damage and you are a Large, Medium or Small Jelly, you can split into 2 Jellys that are a size lower than the original and have half of your current hit points ({{hp}}). All of your jellies count as separate creatures, and are immune to any mind control that does not affect all of them, they all have their own actions and reactions and all take their turns on your initiative. The maximum Hit Points is {{hp}}/2 for Medium Jellys and {{hp}}/4 for Small Jellys and {{hp}}/8 for Tiny Jellys with a minimum HP of 10.

When you are a Large, Medium or Small Jelly, you can split into 2 Jellys that are a size lower than the original and have half of your current hit points ({{hp}}). If you are a Tiny Jelly, you can split into another 2 Tiny Jellies with the same HP. All of your jellies count as separate creatures, and are immune to any mind control that does not affect all of them, they all have their own actions and reactions and all take their turns on your initiative. The maximum Hit Points is {{hp}}/2 for Medium Jellys and {{hp}}/4 for Small Jellys and {{hp}}/8 for Tiny Jellys with a minimum HP of 10.
At the end of combat any remaining jellies may come together as an action to pool hit points.

description.p: You gain greater control of your ability to split. You can now use Split when Small or larger.
In addition, when two or more of your jellies are within 5 feet of a target they have advantage on attack rolls and opposed strength checks against that target.

sheet.description: When two or more of your jellies are within 5 feet of a target they have advantage on attack rolls and opposed strength checks against that target.

Your resistance to Lightning and Slashing now become Immunity to Lightning and Slashing.
You no longer require a reaction to Split, now all of your jellies regardless of size can split, your Tiny jellies split into more Tiny jellies.
Any of your jellies with 10 hit points or more automatically splits when subjected to slashing or lightning damage.

sheet.description: Any of your jellies with 10 hit points or more automatically splits when subjected to slashing or lightning damage.

description.p: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Constitution modifier + your Proficiency modifier.

sheet.description: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals {{ac:unarmored defense ooze}}.

description.p: At 1st level your very touch takes on the aspect of your Ooze. You gain the following benefits with unarmed attacks:

ul.li: You can roll a 2d4 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike and you use Constitution for the attack and damage of your unarmed strikes. This damage changes as you gain Ooze levels, as shown in the Ooze Touch column of the Ooze table. This damage is Acid. Anything that touches you also takes this much damage. For example, a successful grapple check by either party, a successful natural attack against you, a sustained grapple per round, etc.

You can produce a pseudopod at will to either make this attack with, or to manipulate things to one degree or another. How well you can manipulate things is up to your DM, but likely determined by your type of ooze.
You can choose to damper your acid and not harm some things. This is primarily so that you can choose not to harm friendly creatures or objects that you don’t intend to harm.

sheet.description: When you make a basic attack or are touched, you can perform an ooze touch. Your ooze touch does {{ooze touch:dice}}d4 acid damage. You can use Constitution for these attacks. You can produce a pseudopod at will to make this attack with. You can also choose to damper your acid and not harm some things.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you add your Constitution modifier as a bonus to all Strength checks.

sheet.description: You add your Constitution modifier ({{constitution:modifier}}) as a bonus to all Strength checks.

description.p: Your Ooze Touch unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

sheet.description: Your Ooze Touch unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Starting at 4th level you gain Blindsight 30 ft, this improves by another 30 ft at 6th, 9th, 14th, and 18th levels.
When you gain this feature whatever form of normal sight you may have had recedes. You are blind beyond the range of your Blindsight, but become immune to the Blinded condition.

sheet.description: You have Blindsight {{ooze blindsight:value}}ft. You are blind beyond the range of your Blindsight, but become immune to the Blinded condition.

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
This improves at 13th level, allowing you to attack three times instead of once or twice whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
You can attack three times, instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: At 6th level, your sheer toughness lets you shrug off a portion of all incoming damage. When you take damage you reduce the damage you take by your Constitution modifier.
This reduction takes place after any Resistance or Immunity.

sheet.description: Reduce damage taken by {{constitution:modifier}} after any resistance or immunity.

description.p: Beginning at 7th level, your toughness allows you to shrug off assaults that would devastate others.

Whenever you make a saving throw, roll 1d6 and add the die to your saving throw total. If applying this bonus to a death saving throw increases the total to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling a 20 on the d20.

sheet.description: Whenever you make a saving throw, roll 1d6 and add the result. If the result to a death saving throw increases the total to over 20, you automatically roll a 20.

description.p: At 8th level your Constitution increases by +4, your maximum Constitution also increases to 24.
At 16th level your Constitution increases by +4 again and your maximum Constitution increases to 28.
At 20th level your Constitution increases by a final +4 and your maximum Constitution increasing to 32.

sheet.description: Your Constitution increases by +4, your maximum Constitution also increases to 24.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, your proficiency bonus on all Constitution checks is doubled, as if you had Expertise in Constitution checks.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus on all Constitution checks is doubled, as if you had Expertise in Constitution checks.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, your sheer grit grants you proficiency in all saving throws.

sheet.description: You have proficiency in all saving throws.

description.p: Beginning at 16th level, you become immune to the Exhausted, Charmed, Deafened, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Restrained, Stunned or Unconscious conditions.
You cannot be polymorphed against your will.

sheet.description: You are immune to the Exhausted, Charmed, Deafened, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Restrained, Stunned or Unconscious conditions. You cannot be polymorphed against your will.

description.p: At 20th level you have attained the ultimate essence of the Ooze. You have gained perfection. You cannot be killed unless every bit of your ooze mass is disintegrated or otherwise utterly destroyed.
Otherwise when at 1 hit point or more you regain Your Level plus your Constitution Score in hit points every minute. When at 0 hit points you are incapacitated. You are not dead or dying.
Unless otherwise healed you will regain 1 hit point and recover from being incapacitated after 10 minutes.

sheet.description: You cannot be killed unless every bit of your ooze mass is disintegrated or otherwise utterly destroyed. When at 1 hit point or more you regain {{perfection of the ooze}}hp every minute. When at 0 hit points you are incapacitated but not dead or dying.
